title: Lorraine viewers convinced David Bowie's ghost interrupted show
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Lorraine Kelly was welcoming guest Mika onto her show this morning when a live gaffe seemed to suggest that the ghost of the late, great David Bowie gatecrashed the daytime talk show.

The Scottish presenter and the pop star were discussing their mutual love for the Ashes To Ashes hero when, at the very mention of his name, the lights in the studio went haywire, turning off and then turning a dark shade of green.

‘Oh! Hello!’ Lorraine exclaimed. ‘That’s quite spooky. We mentioned David Bowie and look what happened.’

The Space Man popped up on Lorraine today (Picture: ITV/Rex Features)

After the incident, both host and guest looked confused to say the least. Lorraine laughed while composing herself, admitting that she ‘had goosebumps.’

‘Nobody did that,’ the presenter said. ‘That just happened!’

Fans watching the segment live were also convinced that they witnessed something supernatural take place.

lol, the ghost of David Bowie decides to turn off some lights in Lorraine Kelly's studio this morning. #Lorraine — Sally Sebok (@sally_sebok) October 10, 2019

Can’t believe the ghost of David Bowie has just tried to gatecrash Mikas interview. #lorraine — Rebecca Skelly (@becckss) October 10, 2019

After the supposed seance, Bowie superfan Lorraine admitted it was ‘the great regret of my life’ to never meet the icon.

Perhaps her dreams just came true…

Very spooky indeed.

Lorraine airs weekdays at 6am on ITV.
